titlepage.p: SEVENTH SESSION OF THE THIRTY-SEVENTH PARLIAMENT OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND
PRINTED AND PUBLISHED BY HIS MAJESTY'S STATIONERY OFFICE
To be purchased directly from H.M. STATIONERY OFFICE at the following addresses:
York House, Kingsway, London, W.C.2: 120 George Street, Edinburgh 2;
39–41 King Street, Manchester 2; 1 St. Andrew's Crescent, Cardiff;
This volume may be cited as—

section.title: WAR CABINET.
section.p: Prime Minister and Minister of Defence—Rt. Hon. WINSTON CHURCHILL, C.H., M.P.

Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs—Rt. Hon. ANTHONY EDEN, M.C., M.P.

Minister of Labour and National Serviçe—Rt. Hon. ERNEST BEVIN, M.P.

Minister Without Portfolio—Rt. Hon. ARTHUR GREENWOOD, M.P.
Minister of State—Rt. Hon. OLIVER LYTTELTON, D.S.O., M.C., M.P.

section.title:
CHRONOLOGY OF
"THE PARLIAMENTARY DEBATES"
section.p: THE PARLIAMENTARY HISTORY contains all that can be collected of the Legislative History of this country from the Conquest to the close of the XVIIIth Century (1803), 36 vols. The chief sources whence these Debates are derived are the Constitutional History, 24 vols.; Sir Simonds D'Ewes' Journal; Debates of the Commons in 1620 and 1621; Chandler and Timberland's Debates, 22 vols.; Grey's Debates of the Commons, from 1667 to 1694, 10 vols.; Almon's Debates 24 vols.; Debreet's Debates, 63 vols.; The Hardwicke Papers; Debates in Parliament by Dr. Johnson, &c., &c.
THE PARLIAMENTARY DEBATES commenced with the year 1803, and the contents are set forth in the following Chronological Table:—

tr.td: Vol. 1 to 15, 1 WILL.I. to 34 GEO. II.
Vol. 15 to 35, 1 GEO. III. to 40 GEO. III.
PARLIAMENTS OF UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND IRELAND.
EDWARD VII. and I GEO. V.
This volume may be cited as—

section.title:
AN ALPHABETICAL LIST
OF THE
LORDS SPIRITUAL AND TEMPORAL
section.p:
IN THE
SEVENTH SESSION OF THE THIRTY-SEVENTH PARLIAMENT
OF THE
UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN
IRELAND
5 and 6 GEORGE VI. 1941–42

Wigan, David Alexander Robert Lord (Earl of Crawford)

p.i: The following Lords have Two Numbers, being Twice named in the Roll:

section.p: Viscount Simon as Lord High Chancellor and as Viscount Simon. (Nos. 6 and 288)
Duke of Brandon (Duke of Hamilton) as Lord Steward and as Duke of Brandon (Duke of Hamilton). (Nos. 9 and 20)
Earl of Clarendon as Lord Chamberlain and as Earl of Clarendon. (Nos. 57 and 111)
Earl of Lucan as Earl of Lucan and as Lord Bingham. (Nos. 124 and 729)

hansard.p: IN THE SEVENTH SESSION OF THE THIRTY-SEVENTH PARLIAMENT OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND, APPOINTED TO MEET THE TWELFTH DAY OF NOVEMBER IN THE FIFTH YEAR OF THE REIGN OF
